snippet: Opponents say the check-cashing industry is trying to burnish its image while also promoting legislation in Albany to loosen restrictions on short-term loans.
abstract: Check-cashing businesses are often the main contact with the financial system for many of New York City's poorest residents, but the industry has come under increased scrutiny as stores have become full financial centers; critics say the industry takes advantage of those who have no other options, prompting calls for more consumer protections.
lead_paragraph: Opponents say the check-cashing industry is trying to burnish its image while also promoting legislation in Albany to loosen restrictions on short-term loans.

headline.seo: As Check Cashers Expand Services in Poorer Areas, Criticism Grows
headline.main: Criticism Grows as Check-Cashing Stores Expand in Poorer Areas
